thesis.description: This investigation attempts to reveal the causes of educational underachievement of the Kwakiutl Indian pupils in the Gilford Island Indian Day School. The aspects of personality studied were intelligence, health, general overt behavior, attitudes and feelings toward the self and the environment, and adequacy for growth; information being gathered by means of the Goodenough Draw-A-Man Test, Raven Coloured Progressive Matrices (1947), the Thematic Apperception Test, and observations of pupil, sibling and parental behavior.
thesis.creator: Skinner, James. M.
thesis.subject: Education.
thesis.title: Indian education on Gilford Island: the factor of anxiety.
